1 Lesson 1 How many candles are there? Look and listen Chenchen is playing basketball with Steven. His family are very busy. What are Chenchen and Steven going to do? one ◆ Listen again and answer

Here are your gifts. Thank you! How many candles are there? two Whose birthday is it? ◆ Listen again and act 
3 three A: Are there any candles on the cake? B: Yes, there are. A: How many candles are there? B: There are five. A: Are there any gifts on the table? B: No, there aren’t. candles/gifts/on the table books/pens/on the desk computers/TVs/in the room trees/animals/in the park Ask and answer

content: 4 Enjoy reading It’s very hot. There is no water in the river. The bird is very thirsty. He looks for water here and there. Then he finds a bottle. There is some water in it, but he can’t get the water. The bird sees some small stones. He has an idea! He can put the stones into the bottle. One, two, three... He can drink the water now. 7 Look and listen Lesson 2 The Mid-Autumn Festival is coming. 1. Who is Lingling’s friend? 2. What does Lingling want to do? The Mid-Autumn Festival is coming. Lingling and her mother are talking about it. seven ◆ Listen again and answer 
8 Look, listen and say eight Sally: Lingling: Sally: I like mooncakes. They are round and look like the moon. We are going to have a family dinner. Come to my home next Sunday, please! OK. Thank you. ◆ Listen again and act The Mid-Autumn Festival is coming. When is the Mid-Autumn Festival? It’s next Sunday. Lingling: Sally: Lingling: Sally: Lingling: What do you do on the Mid-Autumn Festival? We look at the moon and eat mooncakes. Sometimes, my grandma tells the story of Chang’e.

B: We have a family dinner and tell the story of Chang’e. Ask and answer the Lantern Festival in February yuanxiao watch lanterns Christmas Day in December turkey get Christmas gifts the Spring Festival in January or February jiaozi have a big family dinner the Mid-Autumn Festival next Sunday mooncakes tell the story of Chang’e

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）六年级上册_b4115f1e
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）六年级上册_b4115f1e.pdf

content: 10 Enjoy reading 1. What do children like very much? 2. What do children get on the festival? 3. What do people do on the first day of the festival? ten The Spring Festival The Spring Festival is the Chinese New Year. It comes in January or February. Chinese people have a long holiday for the festival. They go back home and have a big family dinner. Children play with fireworks for the festival. The fireworks are beautiful. Children like them very much. They get “lucky money” from their parents and grandparents. On the first day of the Spring Festival, people often get up early. They go from door to door and say “Happy New Year”. After that, they visit their friends. ◆ R ead again and answer

content: 11 Play a game You are always rolling in the sky . You always come out at night . Sometimes you look like a round bright plate . Sometimes you are like my mother’s smiling eye . I run away to let you far behind . But why are you following me beside? I want to catch you in the green riverside . But I am fuming that you are still shining high . The Moon Enjoy a poem eleven We have a family dinner on the day. Children get gifts on the festival. We eat turkey on the festival. It is... What festival is it? It comes in December.

content: 16 Enjoy reading 1. What does Ann want to do? 2. How does she feel in the end? sixteen How happy am! ◆ Read again and answer Now they are playing with the snow. Dad is rolling a big snowball. Ann is rolling a small one beside him. Mum is helping her. It is snowing. Ann asks dad and mum to play with her in the snow. “All right. Let’s go,” dad says. They are making a snowman. Mum is putting a nose on the snowman’s face. “Are you happy, Ann?” mum says. “Yes, I am!” Ann answers.

19 Look and listen Lesson 4 I was late for school. Did Tom go to school in his mother’s car today? Tom is going to school with his mother. nineteen ◆ Listen again and answer 
20 Look, listen and say Miss Li: Tom: You are late, Tom. Did you get up late? No, I got up at 6:30. But my mother’s car didn’t work. Miss Li: Tom: Miss Li: What did you do, then? I ran to the school. But I was half an hour late. What bad luck! twenty Miss Li: Tom: Why didn’t you take the bus? I tried. I got to the bus stop at 8:10. But the bus didn’t come. ◆ Listen again and act 
21 Look and say twenty-one run to the school/take the bus do my homework/play football read a book/play computer games play the piano/fly kites last night yesterday yesterday last Sunday I ran to the school yesterday. I didn’t take the bus.

content: 22 Enjoy reading Yesterday morning, Tom got up at ten past eight. “I’m late!” he said. He ran out of his house. His father shouted, “Wait, Tom. It’s…” But Tom didn’t listen. He ran to the bus stop. Lingling saw him. She shouted, “Wait, Tom. Today is...” But Tom got on the bus. He got to the school. But there were no pupils there. “Oh! Today is Saturday!” he said. 1. When did Tom get up yesterday? 2. How did he go to school? 3. What day was it yesterday? twenty-two ◆ Read again and answer

Now I’m writing a letter in my room. Jack is swimming. Terry is drawing. John is reading a book. Other kids are playing football near the house. We are having a great time here. Love, Ann Ann writing a letter Jack Terry John Other kids Ask and answer No, he isn’t. He’s playing football.

content: 28 twenty-eight Festivals in America Easter Day comes in March or April. On this day, children get Easter eggs from their parents. Sometimes, their parents hide them. Children try to find them. 1. What do children get on Easter Day? 2. Do they like April Fool’s Day? Why? 3. What do they do on Halloween? April Fool’s Day is on April 1. Children in America like this festival very much. They play tricks on their parents and friends. Halloween comes in October. Children wear funny clothes. They go from house to house and say, “Trick or treat!” People give them candies. Easter Day April Fool’s Day Halloween April October March or April Enjoy reading ◆ Read again and match ◆ Read again and answer

31 It’s 9 o’clock on Sunday, but Tom is in bed. 1. What’s wrong with him? 2. Can Tom go to the park? Lesson 5 I have a headache. Look and listen thirty-one ◆ Listen again and answer 
32 Time to get up, Tom! What’s wrong with you? I have a headache. Yes, I do. You have a cold. Drink some hot water and have a good rest. It’s too bad. I can’t go to the park with Ann. Look, listen and say thirty-two I’m not feeling well, Mum. Let me see. Do you have a runny nose? ◆ Listen again and act 
33 Ask and answer thirty-three A: What’s wrong with you? B: I have a cold. A: Drink some hot water and have a good rest. B: Thank you. have a runny nose go to see a doctor have a cold drink some hot water and have a good rest have a fever take some medicine have a headache go to hospital

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）六年级上册_b4115f1e
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）六年级上册_b4115f1e.pdf

content: 34 There was a football game on TV in the afternoon. Tom wanted to watch it. “It is time to get up,” said mum. “I can’t go to school. I’m not feeling well,” he said. His mum took him to see a doctor. The doctor said, “Don’t worry. He is going to be all right this evening.” Tom didn’t go to school. He watched the football game on TV. Mum found it. She was very angry. Tom felt sad and sorry. 1. Was Tom ill? 2. What did Tom want to do? 3. How did Tom feel in the end? thirty-four Enjoy reading ◆ Read again and answer s Tom ill?

Look at the baby panda. It is sleeping. Pandas like sleeping. Look, listen and say thirty-eight Steven: Lingling: Ha-ha. They are very fat! They are fat and slow, but they can climb trees. metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）六年级上册_b4115f1e

content:
40 Koalas live in trees. They are good at swimming. They have strong legs and arms. A baby koala is very small. It lives in its mother’s “bag”. 1. Where do koalas live? 2. Can koalas swim? 3. What do koalas eat? Enjoy reading Koalas forty ◆ Read again and answer Do you know about koalas? They are small and light gray. They live in Australia. Koalas only eat tree leaves. They don’t drink water. They get water from the leaves. “Koala” means “no water”. Is it interesting? 
41 It is black and white. It likes eating bamboo. It can climb trees. content: 46 The Dog, the Chicken and the Fox A dog and a chicken live on a farm. At night the chicken sleeps in a tree. The dog sleeps in the hole of the tree. A fox sees the chicken and wants to eat it. He says, “Mr Chicken, why not come down and talk with me?” “How about coming up here? It is very nice and cool here,” says the chicken. “My friend can open the door for you.” The fox comes near the hole. The dog jumps out. The fox is afraid and runs away. 1. What does the fox want to do? 2. What does the fox do in the end? 3. What do you think of the chicken ? Enjoy reading forty-six ◆ Read again and answer

content: 52 The Chinatown in New York 1. Why did they go to Chinatown? 2. What did Peter do in Chinatown? Enjoy reading On the Spring Festival, I went to Chinatown with my brother Peter. We visited my grandma. There were a lot of beautiful lanterns in the streets. Peter took a lot of photos. I bought many gifts. We had a good time there. There is a big Chinatown in New York. Every day, a lot of people come to visit it. There are a lot of Chinese shops and supermarkets there. You can buy many nice things in them. fifty-two ◆ Read again and answer
